units_needing_chapters.rationale: SHOWCASE UNIT: Rommel's legendary DAK at peak Operation Battleaxe period. Corps-level formation, 1941-Q2 critical quarter, highest confidence (85%). Essential for North Africa campaign narrative.
SHOWCASE UNIT: DAK during Operation Crusader preparation period. Corps-level, high confidence (83%). Critical Q3 1941 quarter showing DAK at full strength before Crusader offensive.
SHOWCASE UNIT: DAK during Operation Crusader (Nov-Dec 1941). Corps-level, high confidence (82%). Shows DAK composition during largest British offensive of 1941.
SHOWCASE UNIT: DAK initial deployment to North Africa (Feb-Mar 1941). Corps-level, confidence 80%. Historical significance: Rommel's arrival changes campaign dynamics.
SHOWCASE UNIT: DAK during First Battle of El Alamein (July 1942). Corps-level, 1942 peak period, confidence 79%. Critical turning point battle.
SHOWCASE UNIT: Famous Desert Rats after Operation Compass victory. Division-level, Q1 1941, high confidence (82%). British counterpart to DAK, essential for balanced narrative.
SHOWCASE UNIT: Desert Rats during Operation Battleaxe (vs DAK). Division-level, Q2 1941, confidence 82%. Direct opponent to DAK Q2 1941 (priority #1).
SHOWCASE UNIT: Desert Rats preparing for Operation Crusader. Division-level, Q3 1941, confidence 80%. Complements DAK Q3 1941 (priority #2).
SHOWCASE UNIT: Desert Rats during Operation Crusader offensive (Nov-Dec 1941). Division-level, Q4 1941, confidence 76%. Complements DAK Q4 1941 (priority #3).
SHOWCASE UNIT: Elite Italian armored division during Operation Crusader. Division-level, highest confidence (92%). Critical for Axis narrative completeness, famous Battle of Bir el Gubi.
SHOWCASE UNIT: Ariete Division pre-Crusader period. Division-level, Q3 1941, high confidence (87%). Shows Italian armored forces at operational peak.
SHOWCASE UNIT: Ariete Division during Axis offensive spring 1941. Division-level, Q2 1941, confidence 84%. Complements German DAK forces same period.
Desert Rats during Second El Alamein and pursuit to Tunisia. Division-level, Q4 1942, confidence 82%. Critical campaign turning point quarter.
Desert Rats during First El Alamein (July 1942). Division-level, Q3 1942, confidence 80%. Complements DAK Q3 1942 (priority #5).
DAK Q2 1941 alternate file (may be duplicate of priority #1). Corps-level, Q2 1941, confidence 78%. Verify against priority #1 before generating chapter.
DAK during Second El Alamein defeat and retreat (Oct-Dec 1942). Corps-level, Q4 1942, confidence 78%. Critical for campaign conclusion narrative.
Ariete Division final stand at Second El Alamein (destroyed Nov 4, 1942). Division-level, Q4 1942, high confidence (88%). Heroic last stand narrative essential.
Ariete Division at First El Alamein (July 1942). Division-level, Q3 1942, confidence 78%. Shows Italian armored forces during defensive battles.
Ariete Division during post-Compass reorganization. Division-level, Q1 1941, confidence 78%. Shows Italian forces rebuilding after defeats.
DAK Q1 1941 alternate file (may be duplicate of priority #4). Corps-level, Q1 1941, confidence 76%. Verify against priority #4 before generating chapter.

selection_criteria.showcase_units: Deutsches Afrikakorps (DAK), 7th Armoured Division (Desert Rats), 132 Divisione Ariete - highest priority +1000 points

prioritization_notes.showcase_focus: Top 12 priorities are all showcase units (DAK, Desert Rats, Ariete)
prioritization_notes.temporal_coverage: 1941-Q1 through 1942-Q4 complete coverage for major formations
prioritization_notes.narrative_balance: 7x German DAK, 6x British 7th Armoured, 7x Italian Ariete ensures balanced Axis/Allied narrative
prioritization_notes.possible_duplicates: Priorities #15 and #20 may be duplicates of #1 and #4 - verify filenames before chapter generation
prioritization_notes.historical_significance: All 20 units participated in major battles: Battleaxe, Crusader, Gazala, El Alamein

next_steps.immediate: Generate chapters for priorities 1-10 (showcase units, critical 1941 period)
next_steps.phase_2: Generate chapters for priorities 11-20 (1942 period, campaign conclusion)
next_steps.quality_check: Verify no duplicate chapters generated for same unit/quarter combinations

coverage_gaps.no_dak_chapters: Zero chapters for Deutsches Afrikakorps despite 7 completed units across 1941-1942
coverage_gaps.no_desert_rats_chapters: Zero chapters for 7th Armoured Division despite 6+ completed units
coverage_gaps.limited_ariete_coverage: Only 1 chapter (Q3 1942) for Ariete, missing Q1-Q4 1941 critical period
coverage_gaps.focus_on_1942_1943: Most existing chapters are 1942-Q3 through 1943-Q1, missing 1941 campaign start
